Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base, sides expanding to a rounded shoulder, short neck and everted rolled rim, decorated in red paint with crescent or ‘comma’ shaped elements set in groups of three and arranged in three staggered rows around the upper part of the vessel. Paint was applied with fingers.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D66B in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
